titleStmt.title: 71 - The Returned Volunteer to his Rifle

head.hi: The Returned Volunteer to his Rifle.

lg.l: Thou tried companion, whom at last I greet
By steepy banks of Hudson here.
How oft I told thee of this scene—
The Highlands[allusion] [place] The mountains on either side of the Hudson River in New York. (Eric Meckley) blue—the river's narrowing sheen.
To find such haven; but God kept it green.
Long rest! with belt, and bayonet, and canteen.
